oh, they're really good books... if you are okay with fantasy books

never heard of them
I'm a fan of fantasy, but not of books with no conclusions or, at least, intermediate denouements between installments. tv might actually be a superior format for those stories

@christineyen it's true that the books don't really have good conclusions
YESSS, I love these books
I hope George R R Martin survives to finish writing the series. He doesn't look too healthy and at the rate he's writing, it'll be another 15 years...
Woo-hoo...next Sunday! Terrific NYTimes article http://tinyurl.com/3g3kt8j
And did you see the first 14 minutes? It looks wonderful. http://tinyurl.com/4xlcr6s
Oh, I thought the series was done after four books...Did some research and there's three more. Grah, why did the release a book set already? : |
There's an interesting profile of George RR Martin in the latest New Yorker... I hadn't really heard of them, but now I'm intrigued to read his stuff
he's got some really batshit crazy fans

I'll have to read that New Yorker piece. I did read all the books. And at first I was, like, this really isn't my type of book, I'm not crazy about them... as I continued feverishly to plow through book after book. And then, when I got to the end of Book 5, I was soooo looking forward to the next one when I found out that they're not finished yet! Oy. I was hooked.

Yeah. I was a bit bored for the first quarter of book one, way back when i first encountered the Song of Ice and Fire series. Then I realized that while it is fantasy, GRRM wasn't writing your typical, cliched coming-of-age, farmboy-slays-the-dragon-and-becomes king type story. He's crafted something more nuanced, shades-of-grey and layered. Awesome stuff, can't wait til the premier.
@Anneflo hey
@leah I've read them. So excited for the series, although hope I don't have to get hbo
@mwhooker unless you plan on pirating or waiting for the DVD you'll have to get HBO

There was just a piece on public radio about how producing G of T is quite a different project for HBO & they're hoping it translates into new viewers. They interviewed a guy who, with some friends, were all chipping in for 1 HBO account & they were all going to gather to watch it. At the end of the piece it was brought up that whether the series can continue may depend on how many new voewers they get.
HBO more or less greenlit a second season in a post on EW's blog the other day.
FYI Game of Thrones discussion also going on here: https://convore.com/game-of-thrones/

I'm pretty interested in the movie, though it makes me realize that I first found out about the books a few years ago and have yet to get around to reading them. I read a lot, but there are just so many books out there that my "To Read" list never gets any shorter.
I wanna see this. Is it good ?
It's really great.
watched the first episode last night and I really liked it, hopefully it keeps up.
